intro: Launaea asymmetrica, commonly known as the asymmetric dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous small florets. The plant has a succulent, hairy stem that helps it retain moisture in harsh environments. Its leaves are typically lobed and arranged in a rosette pattern, reducing water loss through transpiration. Launaea asymmetrica produces yellow flowers that develop into fluffy seed heads, aiding in wind pollination and seed dispersal.
